circumstances: When the pilot proceeded to the engine start-up at Dublin-New River Valley Airport, the left engine could not start for unknown reason. The pilot decided to takeoff with the right engine only. After liftoff, the airplane encountered difficulties to gain height, struck power cables and crashed in flames. The aircraft was destroyed and the pilot was seriously injured.
probable_cause:
The accident was the consequence of the combination of the following factors:
- The pilot exercised poor judgement, 
- The pilot attempted operation with known deficiencies in equipment, 
- The pilot failed to obtain flying speed, 
- The pilot failed to maintain directional control,
- Un start left engine on ground, 
- Takeoff with right engine only.
